subsc: Animal production,Roads and highways,Irrigation and drainage,Forestry,Crops

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Algeria Second Rural
            Employment Project were as follows: outcomes for the first
            project were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome
            was moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was satsifactory. Some lessons learned
            included: 1) the project has demonstrated that it is
            possible to simultaneously resolve rural unemployment
            problems and promote agricultural growth, improve the
            conditions of the natural resource base and protect the
            environment; 2) the funding of income-generating activities
            must be based on prior sound technical and economic
            feasibility studies; 3) although investment funding
            decisions were made using good and reliable information,
            more time should be given in the future for more sound
            feasibility studies; and 4) as for most projects of this
            type, little is achieved, in physical terms, during the
            first two years of implementation because the bottom-up and
            participatory approach requires that most of the investments
            be designed and decided upon with the beneficiaries, after
            the project is approved and becomes effective.
